info.title: Bambuser Metadata
info.description: The Metadata API allows external services to access parts of the Bambuser database via HTTP.

get.description: Returns metadata for a set of broadcasts matching the query parameters. This endpoint replaces getVideos.

parameters.name: geo_distance
parameters.description: Limit the search geographically, by setting geo_distance to a radius in meters. You also need to specify the center point by setting lat and lon.

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: Latitude of the center point, when limiting search to a geographic area.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of search results. Should be a positive numeric value.

parameters.name: long
parameters.description: Longitude of the center point, when limiting search to a geographic area.

parameters.name: max_age
parameters.description: Limit the search to broadcasts created within x seconds. Should be a positive numeric value.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Access older results by specifying which results page you want returned.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Filter search by a single tag or a set of tags separated by a comma (,).

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Limit search to a single user or a set of users separated by comma (,).

broadcast_not_found.description: The specified broadcast id is not valid.

broadcast_removed.description: The owner of this broadcast chose to remove the specified broadcast.

broadcast_not_archived.description: The owner of the specified broadcast chose to disable archiving, hence it only existed as a live stream.

broadcast_not_available.description: The specified broadcast is currently unavailable for some unspecified reason.

broadcast_no_access.description: You do not have permission to access to the specified broadcast. This error is returned if you try to access a private broadcast.

user_not_available.description: he user account that the selected broadcast was produced with is not available anymore.
